articles.description: WINSTON — We’ve Got Your Six, a veteran/first responder suicide prevention fundraiser, will be held from 11 a.m. to dusk Saturday, Sept. 28, at Riverbend Park in Winston.
articles.title: Winston hosts fundraiser for veteran/first responder suicide prevention

articles.author: KIMBERLI HOLMQUIST The News-Review
articles.description: DOUGLAS COUNTY — First responders met the heroes challenge, earning more than $10,000 for Mercy Foundation on Sept 19.
articles.title: First responders raise $10K for Mercy Foundation

articles.author: SANNE GODFREY The News-Review
articles.description: WINSTON — Wildlife Safari introduced its newest resident, a female southern white rhino named Mguu, on Sunday during World Rhino Day.
articles.title: Mguu makes debut during World Rhino Day

articles.description:
SALEM, Ore. – The Nature Conservancy of Oregon and the Klamath Tribes (represented by Craig Bienz and Steve Rondeau), forest landowners David and Mary Ann Bugni, and Searching for Climate-Smarter Forestry leads Dean Moburg and Peter Hayes were recognized earlier this month by the Oregon Board of Forestry with the Oregon Department of Forestry’s first Climate Smart Forestry Awards, a new honor developed by the agency following adoption of its 2021 Climate Change and Carbon Plan.
The award recognizes landowners, land managers, researchers, operators and other forestry professionals who use climate change-adapted practices or develop innovative methods for carbon capture and/or retention, or reduced carbon release. Nominees are considered for exemplary climate smart research and/or innovation…
articles.title: Oregon Department of Forestry announces recipients of first Climate Smart Forestry Awards (Photo)
